text: Does anyone know of a good AMP testing tool as you can't use <https://search.google.com/search-console/amp> on pages with the *.<http://hs-sites.com|hs-sites.com> domain because its blocked by the domains robots file
is the `?hs_amp=true` the preview?
one thing i noticed is I enabled it on a old post we had on our domain. Once i ran it through the google search console amp check, it keeps coming up invalid. Does anyone else have this issue?
Yes, the `?hs_amp=true` is the AMP preview URL. Example: <https://blog.HubSpot.com/marketing/what-to-post-on-instagram?hs_amp=true>
Thanks <@U22PU4G4A>
Have you run the post through the AMP Validator? <https://validator.ampproject.org/>
Just did. it works. One question on this though, it doesnt look like we can control the styling on the page at the moment. Will we have access to the `<style amp-custom>...</style>` tag at all?
that would completely circumvent the need to create a custom query to make our own amp pages
Looks like any HubL you have in the body is also stripped out on the Amp Page is this correct?
at least when i tried calling variables from the developer info.

Hi all, if anybody has some time, I will appreciate if anyone can answer this question to a friend: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/COS-Design-Support/HubSpot-Form-submission-Using-AJAX/m-p/15582#M1487>

Hey <@U22PU4G4A> any update on when Dev Day might be? We're trying to make our agency's INBOUND plans and I remember there was talk before about having Developer Day right afterwards in early October... Any hints you can give would be appreciated!
<@U4WS10WCQ>  I answered here: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/COS-Design-Support/HubSpot-Form-submission-Using-AJAX/m-p/15582/highlight/false#M1487>
having some problems loopping in the blog
I'm trying to see if a blog post has a certain topic, I'm setting a variable, but outside of the loop the variable reverts back
is there a better hubl function to check to see if a topic exists for a post so I don't have to loop?

<@U25PYL3Q8|nickdeckerdevs> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/nickdeckerdevs/F5ETQ5FS9/work_around_for_losing_the_variable_in_for_loop.php|work around for losing the variable in for loop>

this is inside the contents loop in the blog listing page. I needed to display a blog post differently based upon the blog topic (if press release, display a certain type, and then if not display differently)

so I set the variable before the loop, check for the blog topic. If it matches I set the variable to true and end out. Then I check to see if it is false and is last in the loop (meaning that it hasn't been press release, and it is in the last blog topic)
then I display it differently.
would be nicer to do something like   {% if content.topic_list|in_array('press_release') %}
is something like that possible?
close to what you’d do
{% if topic in content.topic_list|map(‘name’) %}
so {% if ‘press_release’ in content.topic_list|map(‘name’) %} {# DO THINGS #}
